title: What an emotional Drake Maye said of Super Bowl LX loss
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: Drake Maye expressed regret after the Patriots' 29-13 loss to Seattle in Super Bowl LX.
The Patriots struggled offensively, with Maye responsible for three second-half turnovers leading to 17 Seattle points.
Despite the loss, Maye praised his teammates and reflected on the team's unexpected journey to the championship game.

title: Super Bowl 2026: Bad Bunny performs joyful, controversy-free halftime show
author: Kevin Slane
bullets: Bad Bunny performed a joyful Super Bowl 60 halftime show at Levi's Stadium featuring Latin culture and notable guest performers.
Lady Gaga and Ricky Martin joined Bad Bunny, with Gaga singing a salsa-inspired duet alongside salsa group Los Sobrinos.
Despite political criticism, the performance emphasized love and unity, ending with a message of togetherness on the Jumbotron.

title: Super Bowl celebrities: Here’s who was spotted in Santa Clara
author: Samantha Genzer
bullets: Super Bowl LX attracted numerous celebrities, including Jay-Z, Blue Ivy, and Peyton Manning at Levi's Stadium in Santa Clara.
Bad Bunny's halftime show featured pop artists Lady Gaga, Cardi B, and Karol G, entertaining the Super Bowl audience.
Former NFL player tributes included Drew Brees, Luke Kuechly, and Emmitt Smith during the game between the Patriots and Seahawks.

title: Mass. State Police report fake account impersonating trooper
author: Molly Farrar
bullets: Massachusetts State Police warn against a fake Instagram account impersonating a trooper with over 100,000 followers.
The account named 'Sarita' uses AI-generated images of a woman in MSP uniform and links to adult content.
A similar account with nearly 300,000 followers impersonates a Santa Monica officer with overlapping content.

title: In Patriots territory, Seahawks fans find a home base for the Super Bowl
author: Samantha Genzer
bullets: Alma Cantina and White Bull Tavern hosted a Seattle Seahawks watch party in Boston on Super Bowl Sunday.
The partnership with the Boston Seahawks Fan group began two years ago, creating a fan base for displaced Seahawks fans.
Both venues were fully reserved, with Alma Cantina receiving over 100 reservations, excluding walk-ins, according to its general manager.

title: Watch: Patriots’ Stefon Diggs shoved to the ground as punches fly during sideline scuffle
author: Khari A. Thompson
bullets: Patriots' Stefon Diggs and Seattle's Josh Jobe involved in sideline altercation with no penalties or ejections.
Jobe shoved Diggs to the ground and appeared to throw punches during the incident as Patriots trailed by double digits.
Stefon Diggs, facing unrelated assault and strangulation charges, has an arraignment scheduled for February 13.

title: Green Line service suspended between Park Street and Government Center after train derails
author: Carson Lyle
bullets: Green Line service suspended between Park Street and Government Center due to a train derailment at Park Street station.
MBTA announced service suspension at 2:46 p.m. and confirmed the failed trolley was rerailed by 6:43 p.m.
Repairs and inspections continue at Park Street platform; riders are advised to use the Orange Line as an alternative.

title: ‘Good Will Dunkin’: Watch Ben Affleck, Tom Brady, Jennifer Aniston, and more in 2026 Super Bowl commercial
author: Kevin Slane
bullets: Ben Affleck stars in a Dunkin' 2026 Super Bowl commercial parodying 'Good Will Hunting' with '90s sitcom stars.
Tom Brady, Jennifer Aniston, Ted Danson, and Jason Alexander are among the celebrities featured in the comedic ad.
The commercial aired before halftime, featuring Affleck's character working at Dunkin' and a humorous nod to '90s pop culture.

title: Here’s Ann Michael Maye’s custom look for Super Bowl Sunday
author: Samantha Genzer
bullets: Ann Michael Maye wore a custom Patriots jacket and studded white jeans to Super Bowl 60 in Santa Clara.
The jacket was designed by Kristin Juszczyk, highlighting collaboration between spouses of NFL players.
Ann Michael Maye rose to social media fame with baking videos and attended pre-game events, sharing updates online.

title: Fall River man shot dead by police after shooting 2 officers, DA says
author: Molly Farrar
bullets: Nigel Vaughn, 40, was shot by Fall River police after allegedly shooting two officers; one hit in the elbow, the other in a vest.
The shooting occurred after a 911 call about a firearm in a vehicle; police found Vaughn resisting during a pat frisk.
Vaughn's firearm was modified to be fully automatic; police had interacted with him earlier at a gas station for reckless driving.
